answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.Spinal stenosis refers to narrowing of the spinal canal. Neuroforamen is the opening in the spinal canal through which nerve roots come out. Stenosis of the neuroforamen results in compression of the nerve roots.It is a part of aging process although it is frequently associated with diabetes. Herniation of the disc or hypertrophy of the ligaments can lead to stenosis of the neuroforamin.Take care!

question: What is significant bilateral neural foraminal stenosis?
title: Spine Diagnosis
